title: Verify: Xbox Live user sign in prompt when Selecting the Fox Sports Go app icon
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox One device
AND user is NOT signed in to an XBox Live account
AND the "Fox Sports Go" app is present in the device Apps Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Fox Sports Go from the device Apps menu
custom_expected:
THEN the system will display an Xbox Live user sign in prompt
AND the Fox Sports Go app will not open 

note: once the XBlive user has signed in, the app must be selected (again) for it to launch

title: Verify: Selecting the Fox Sports Go app icon successfully opens the Fox Sports Go app
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox One device
AND user is signed in to an XBox Live account
AND the "Fox Sports Go" app is present in the device Apps Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Fox Sports Go from the device Apps menu
custom_expected: THEN the Fox Sports Go app will open successfully

title: Verify: Fox Sports Go can be accessed while the Xbox One is connected wirelessly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Xbox One
AND the device is currently connected to a wireless network
AND the "Fox Sports Go" app is present in the device Apps Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Fox Sports Go from the device Apps menu
custom_expected: THEN the Fox Sports Go app will open successfully

title: Verify: Fox Sports Go can be accessed while the Xbox One device is connected using a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup the Xbox One device
AND the XBox One is connected to the internet via a wired connection
AND the "Fox Sports Go" app is present in the device Apps Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Fox Sports Go from the device Apps menu
custom_expected: THEN the Fox Sports Go app will open successfully

title: Unauthenticated account is allowed to browse content items found within the Fox Sports Go App
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through Content Files 
AND the user navigates through any/all Content items found within the App
custom_expected:
The user will be prompted with Content files that contain "Key" icons on top of their photo tile if Authentication is required for access
AND "Key" icon will not display on tiles for programs that do not require authentication.






-------------------------

EPG for reference:
https://media-api.foxsportsgo.com/epg/ws/live/all

title: Cable Authorization "Activate" initialization when Content item is selected for Playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND user has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through Content Files (aka chips)
AND the selects a locked *chip to PLAY the media content


*Note: currently only LIVE chips are playable
custom_expected:
THEN the app will update the screen to Settings with TV provider Sign IN screen displayed
AND user will be prompted with the Cable Authorization "Activate" screen, with full CODE and website details

title: "Activate" Notification for Cable Provider - Web Flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through Content Files (aka chips)
AND the selects a locked (LIVE) chip to PLAY the media content
AND is prompted with the "Activate" Cable Authentication screen
custom_expected:
The user can initiate registration of app (on Web ONLY) via the Cable Provider Authentication process
And once registration completes, the app updates and unlocks appropriate content per registered MVPD account.

title: Cable Authentication - Web Flow - Desktop License Plate
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through Content Files 
THEN presses select to ENTER and PLAY the media content
AND is prompted with the "Activate" Cable Authentication screen
THEN uses a Desktop computer to access the "www.foxsportsgo.com/Activate" site
custom_expected: The user will be prompted with the Desktop License Plate Web Interface

title: Cable Authentication - Web Flow - Enter Device Application Code
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go Web "Activate" code Desktop License 
AND has entered the Authentication Code provided within the Fox Sports Go Device app
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initiates the Web-ONLY section of the Cable Provider Authentication process
AND has entered the Authentication Code provided within the Fox Sports Go Device app 
THEN clicks submit within the Desktop License plate
custom_expected: THE user will be prompted within the Web License Plate to select a Cable Provider

title: Desktop DIRECTV Sign In - Authentication Initialization
custom_preconds:
++++++This case contains steps needed to complete authentication of account for use in app.++++  editing/reworking of  cases needed...


GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user enters their Device Code found within the Device application "Activate" screen in the Desktop License Plate
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is prompted with the featured Cable Provider buttons within the Desktop TV Provider Selection screen
THEN chooses a specific Cable Provider for authentication within the Cable Provider listings on the Web (for this instance DirecTV was used)
AND is prompted with the Cable Authentication sub-menu screen (see DirecTV screencap attachment)
custom_expected: The user will begin to enter valid Cable authentication details within the sub-menu screen

title: Desktop DIRECTV Sign In - Authentication - Bad Credentials
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user enters their Device Code found within the Device application "Activate" screen in the Desktop License Plate
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is prompted with the main 9 Cable Provider buttons within the Desktop TV Provider Selection screen
THEN chooses a specific Cable Provider for authentication within the Cable Provider listings on the Web (for this instance DirecTV was used)
AND is prompted with the Cable Authentication sub-menu screen (see DirecTV screencap attachment)
THEN the user will enters invalid Cable authentication details within the sub-menu screen
custom_expected:
The user will be prompted with error messaging and will have to re-enter valid authentication credentials

The FSGO app will not authenticate/unlock content when invalid credentials are used.

title: Desktop Activation Complete â€“ Sign In/Sign Up to FS Account - Confirmation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user enters their Device Code found within the Device application "Activate" screen in the Desktop License Plate
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is prompted with the main Cable Provider buttons within the Desktop TV Provider Selection screen
THEN chooses a specific Cable Provider for authentication within the Cable Provider listings on the Web (for this instance DirecTV was used)
AND is prompted with the Cable Authentication sub-menu screen 
THEN enters valid Cable Provider authentication email and password for the selected provider
custom_expected: The user will be prompted with the activation "Success" screen on the Web

title: Tile "Key" icon removal from all Content items
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user prompted with the activation "Success" screen on the Web
THEN returns back to the Fox Sports Go application on device 
AND begins cycling through all Content menu items
custom_expected: The user will notice that all previous Content items no longer contain the "Key" icon found previously within the menu tiles

title: Access to all previously gated areas of application (LiveTV / VOD)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user prompted with the activation "Success" screen on the Web
THEN returns back to the Fox Sports Go application on the device 
AND begins cycling through all Content menu items
custom_expected:
The user will notice that all previous Menu items will now be accessible 

NOTE:  UWP app does not currently have VOD content available, content in Live EPG is only playable.

title: Menu - Landing Page (home/default view) Verification - UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND have signed into an Xbox Live account
custom_steps: WHEN we launch the app and it has successfully loaded
custom_expected:
Then we will see the screen divided into two sections: Menu & Page

MENU overlay (at left edge):
* displays the FSGO Logo in upper left corner 
and
*3 menu three tabs (below):
***LIVE TV
***SEARCH
***SETTINGS

(Above are the current Phase v.1 items, with more Phases additional Menu items are set to be introduced)
Menu is sliding overlay: that slides right over the page contents when in focus; and slides left & minimizes, hiding menu names to display only icons when Page is in focus.


PAGE (screen right, sits under the menu in the stack):
Page displays contents for whatever menu item is in focus

title: Menu Shift Verification - UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND have signed into an Xbox Live account
AND launched the app
custom_steps:
WHEN the left menus is in focus
AND we navigate Right (using d-pad, stick, or menu button)
custom_expected: Menu is minimized and slides in to left. When user scrolls back to left, the menu slides out to the right along with the first chips. (Menu selection items - LIVE TV / SEARCH)

title: Verify Menu Content items are appearing properly within the application
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND the USER browsing Content items found within the application
custom_steps: WHEN the user starts scrolling through the Menu items
custom_expected:
THEN Menu selection items - LIVE TV / SEARCH / Settings will be visible and accessible 

***Above are the current Phase v.1 items, with more Phases additional Menu items are set to be introduced***

title: Live Linear Schedule - "LIVE" Video content Playback Start to Exit
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND the USER is signed in with a valid Cable Authentication account
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch ANY LIVE TV video feed with a TRT > 2mins
AND watch to completion and/or exit stream
custom_expected:
THEN playback will commence and continue without stalls or skips
AND the user will not be kicked out of the stream unexpectedly

title: Full Featured item Playback to Exit
custom_preconds: GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
custom_steps:
WHEN we launch ANY "Featured" video content item
AND watch to completion
custom_expected:
THEN playback will commence and continue without stalls or skips
AND the user will not be kicked out of the stream unexpectedly
AND upon completion the app will return to Featured asset page

custom_expected:
reference this epg for all LIVE events:
https://media-api.foxsportsgo.com/epg/ws/live/all

Note: FSGO web account must signed in (or previously signed in) with same credentials used on Xbox app to access this https url.

title: Verify All Upcoming Content items - TODAY's plus next 6 days worth of programming populate sub-menu display
custom_preconds:
EPG (Electronic Program Guide) displays channels per MVPD authorization.  
If a channel is not part of MVPD package, then channel will not display in app when logged in with that MVPD account.

title: Verify Featured Chip items (Featured Content Show Tiles) appear and are accessible
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the "Fox Sports Go" application
AND the USER browsing Content items found within the application

***If no programs are above the "minimum threshold promotional value" then the Featured section should be removed.***
custom_steps: WHEN the user starts scrolling through the Featured sub-section items
custom_expected: There will be a limit of six programs/chips found within the Featured sub-section.

title: Verify that Feature Content Show Tiles (chips) are correct size
custom_expected: There will never have a double wide chip in the Featured section and the chips will be ordered in chronology.

title: Wired Connection: Launch and playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the Fox Sports Go their device connected to a wired network connection
AND the user has accessed the "Fox Sports Go" Application
custom_steps:
WHEN the USER locates any (unlocked) media content file
AND the USER attempts to play that media content file
custom_expected:
THEN the media video stream will launch successfully
AND the media content file will play without issue

title: Wireless Connection: Launch and playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the Fox Sports Go app installed on their device connected to a wireless network connection
AND the user has accessed the "Fox Sports Go" Application
custom_steps:
WHEN the USER locates any (unlocked) media content file
AND the USER attempts to play that media content file
custom_expected:
THEN the media video stream will launch successfully
AND the media content file will play without issue

title: Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations
custom_steps:
(With XB1 proxied through fiddler)
XB1 - Launch Playback of video
Dev PC - In Fiddler select Rules > Performance > Simulate Modem speeds to enable/disable rules modem settings
custom_expected:
Video playback streams adapt to bandwidth as available.
max allowed per video view:
Full screen 5000
PIP  5000/900
Dual 1200/1200
Mosaic 900/900/900/900

title: Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement
Network: Verify when throttling connection strength that bitrate playback adjusts without issue in both directions
LIVE Video Playback: Wired Connection Lost
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Video Stream is successfully playing full screen
AND the device is connected to a wired network connection
custom_steps: WHEN we disconnect the LAN from the wall
custom_expected:
THEN an expected network failure message appears for the application

note: xbox caches about 30 seconds of video, playback may not be effected immediately
or -  if wireless network has previously been configured on device it may switch to wireless connection seamlessly and not display network error

title: LIVE Video Playback: Wired Connection Restored (after loss)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Video Stream is successfully playing full screen
AND the device is connected to a wired network connection
custom_steps:
WHEN we disconnect the LAN from the wall (or device)
AND we see video stop playback
AND the appropriate error message displays
AND we reconnect LAN
custom_expected:
THEN the expected network failure message will be dismissible
AND we will be able to resume video playback

note: xbox caches about 30 seconds of video, playback may not be effected immediately
or -  if wireless network has previously been configured on device it may switch to wireless connection seamlessly and not display network error

title: LIVE Video Playback: Wireless Connection Lost ***
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Video Stream is successfully playing full screen
AND the device is connected to an Ad Hoc wifi network
custom_steps: WHEN we turn off the Ad Hoc wifi network
custom_expected: THEN an expected network failure message appears for the application

title: LIVE Video Playback: Wireless Connection Lost ***
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Video Stream is successfully playing full screen
AND the device is connected to an Ad Hoc wifi network
custom_steps:
WHEN we turn off the Ad Hoc wifi network
AND we see video stop playback
AND the appropriate error message displays
AND we reconnect wifi
custom_expected:
THEN the expected network failure message will be dismissible
AND we will be able to resume video playback

note: xbox caches about 30 seconds of video, playback may not be effected immediately
or - if wireless network has previously been configured on device it may switch to wireless connection seamlessly and not display network error

title: Verify Search box appears when user taps on SEARCH category on the menu
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND Search menu option has been selected
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to Search and selects
custom_expected:
THEN Search page displays at the right of the menu
WITH an entry field at the top of page
AND two columns below:
(left) Recent Searches
(right) Channels

AND the page is navigable
AND and displays all text/graphics without issue

title: Verify selected Search entry field opens virtual keyboard
custom_preconds:
*Test should be performed with game controller, media remote, and smartglass app (is possible)

GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND Search menu option has been selected
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes Search Functionality
AND selects the entry field
custom_expected:
THEN the cursor displays in the entry field
AND the virtual keyboard opens 
AND user is able to enter search terms

title: Verify Search results display
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND Search menu option has been selected
custom_steps:
WHEN Search term has been entered
AND results are returned
custom_expected:
THEN the search term displays in the 1st position under Recent Searches
AND the results display (on right side of screen; replacing the Channels list) in a vertical scrolling sequential list with currently live Live programs at top:
*Events Only (on/off toggle) - to filter results


(see screenshot attached)

title: Verify Auto-Population for Text search functionality
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND Search menu option has been selected
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes Search Functionality
AND begins to type characters in the entry box
custom_expected:
THEN a list of suggestions (related to entered characters) displays below the box
AND the list is scrollable
AND each suggested item in the list is selectable

title: Verify Recent Search Topic Selected
custom_preconds: Have Search resultants from Previously Searched items
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes Search Functionality
AND selects one of the 'Recent Searches'
custom_expected: THEN the related results will display at right

title: IGNORE THIS CASE (possible future implementation) Verify My Teams in Search ***FanHood DNA Functionality***
custom_preconds:
My teams in search - Show logos of teams the user has favorited on Fanhood DNA. When tapped, the search results will be filtered by the team selected. When the list gets long, it's scrollable within area.
 
User selects a team by arrowing to the team logo (indicated by orange underscore bar) and then pressing the ENTER button.
 
All Favs - Filter search results with all the favorited teams the user has selected on Fanhood DNA.
 
Show my teams logo based on what user has rated the team in Fanhood DNA. Show in order of Diehard, Active, and Casual. Display teams in each section in alphabetical order if there are more than one team.

title: Sign-In - App Settings Menu flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND has not authenticated their *Cable Provider account details
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through the FOX Sports Go app on the device
THEN enters the Settings menu
AND selects the *TV Provider Sign In button




*a.k.a. "MVPD"
custom_expected:
THEN a unique auth code (a.k.a. license plate) to initialize the Full Cable Provider Verification displays
 - Web Flow is required to enter valid MVPD Subscription credentials  



NOTE: User MUST remain on the Sign In screen while authenticating on web for the XB to receive the authentication success response.

title: Sign-Out - App Settings Menu flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app has been accessed
AND the user has authenticated their Cable Provider account details via Gated content entitlement check or App Settings Menu flow
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates through the Signed-In FOX Sports Go app on the device

THEN enters the Settings menu

AND initiates the MVPD Sign Out button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be signed out of the MVPD account
AND the "Sign Out" option will update to display the  "TV Provider Sign In" option
AND the app will return to its previous UnAuthenticated state 
AND only Content tiles that no not require authentication will be available for playback
AND all other items will contain the "Key" icon within their tile graphic

title: Verify Closed Caption Button is present and accessible within Video Player UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes playback for any Content items (LIVE/FEATURED)
THEN toggles the Video Player UI
custom_expected:
THEN User can toggle on/off the CC in the video player. 

note: Default or custom CC display will be used per XB1 system settings for 'ease of access' CC display.

title: Verify Closed Captions are appearing when User has Toggled setting to "ON"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes playback for any Content items (LIVE/FEATURED)
THEN toggles the Video Player CC UI to "ON"
custom_expected: THEN the user will view Closed Captions during the the duration of the video's playback

title: Verify Closed Captions are not appearing when User has Toggled setting to "OFF"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Fox Sports Go app Cable Authentication Web Flow has been initiated
AND the user has completed the full Device App code/Cable Authentication flow via Device and Desktop Web
custom_steps:
WHEN the user initializes playback for any Content items (LIVE/FEATURED)
THEN toggles the Video Player Closed Caption UI from "ON" (when applicable) to "OFF"
custom_expected: THEN the user will no longer have Closed Captions text appearing on-screen during the the duration of the video's playback
